articles.title: CALENDAR OF EVENTS
articles.summary: This document outlines an astronomy association's calendar of events for August and September, featuring various activities. Highlights include a meeting on comet hunting by Don Machholz, multiple observing sessions at locations like El Sereno and Fremont Peak, and an AANC/NASA Joint Conference on Astronomy with mandatory pre-registration. Other events include a board meeting and a presentation by Dr. E.R. Therkelson.

articles.title: NEW OFFICERS ELECTED
articles.summary: The San Jose Astronomical Association's Board of Directors elected new officers for the upcoming year at their June 10 board meeting. John D. Rhodes was elected President, Gerald W. Rattley as Vice President, Robert Fingerhut as Treasurer, and Cathy Pinheiro as Secretary.

articles.title: BULLETIN EDITOR RESIGNS
articles.summary: The current editor of the SJAA bulletin is resigning effective after the September issue. This creates an opening for a new editor, and interested members are encouraged to apply. The outgoing editor expressed appreciation to those who contributed to the bulletin.

articles.title: Save these Maps for future confusion
articles.summary: This document features a humorously inaccurate and convoluted map offering 'approximate directions' to the Los Gatos Red Cross, laden with nonsensical landmarks. It also includes a 'news notz' section compiling several astronomical updates from July 1986, discussing topics like X-ray astronomy, Halley's Comet, cosmic background radiation, and celestial observations.

articles.title: A D S I N F I N I T U M
articles.summary: This document features several classified advertisements for astronomical equipment, including a Maksutov telescope, a dual Newtonian setup with digital control, and a Celestron 5" f/6 telescope/telephoto. It also contains a "Found" notice for a Sanyo rechargeable flashlight located at Ed Levin Park.
